answers.answer: Hi,This may be related to a  vascular, circulation problem or some growth.  Diabetes, smoking,  high cholesterol or peripheral vascular disease are commonly associated with a circulation deficiency.  You may want to discuss the option of an angiographic study, plethysmography (the measurement of volume change in an organ or limb) or ultrasound to evaluate for circulatory disorders.Another possibility could be a mass that may be obstructing blood flow.  To test for this, imaging would need to be performed - either an abdominal/pelvic CT scan or ultrasound.A referral to a urologist or vascular surgeon would be reasonable for further evaluation.  After they examine you, discuss the utility of imaging or testing for vascular disease.Regards.

question: i found that wen i pulled the foreskin back on my penis there was a bluish like brusing to the head. i was wondering if this is serious as wel wen i pulled it back it was extremely sensitive. Is it serious ?thanx
title: blue penis
